headline: Airlines will need time to 'smooth out' following gov't shutdown
summary: While President Trump signed a federal funding bill that reopened the US government earlier this week, does this give enough time for the airline industry to bounce back and get its ducks in a row before Americans take to the skies for Thanksgiving? The Points Guy Director of Content Eric Rosen sits down with Myles Udland on Market Domination Overtime to talk about recent flight cancellations and the advantages of TSA PreCheck ahead of the busy holiday travel season. At Yahoo Finance Invest, Delta Air Lines (DAL) CEO Ed Bastian called the government shutdown "inexcusable" and "incredibly disruptive." Also hear Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst George Ferguson's thoughts on holiday travel disruptions. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.
